statements.statement: Take time for every patient.
Accept the absence of a sick colleague without comments.
Discuss inadequate performance of colleagues with them
Systematically take time for our own professional development.
Discuss with patients the option of doing nothing or stopping treatment if appropriate.
Ask about and listen to the patient’s own needs.
Show appreciation to colleagues.
Ask questions when there is something we don’t know.
Live a healthy life and take care of ourselves.
Practice shared decision making.
Always treat each patient respectfully under all circumstances.
Ask colleagues for emotional support.
Try to learn from errors.
Offer colleagues emotional support.
Discuss with colleagues aspects of our work we feel uncertain about.
Keep our professional distance from patients.
Talk respectfully about patients, whether they are present or not.
Discuss with colleagues overload of work.
Apologize to each other for mistakes.
Subordinate personal needs (pausing, eating, drinking) to the workflow.
Regard the patient as a whole person.
Inform colleagues about our private problems.
Apologize to patients and their family for errors.
Deal carefully with privacy and confidentiality of patients.
